channel.title: Help
channel.description:
Ok recently. i made a kick command.. well it is all set up.. and then when i compiled i got an error for an int. so i added 1.. then i get the error for this
[code]public static int removePlayer(int id) { if (players[id] == null) { return;[/code]
it comes out like this
[code].\palidino76\rs2\Engine.java:251: missing return value return; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
... ehh its getting annoying..

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

eh no errors lol… thanks guys.

Read full topic

@Yz85Racer wrote:

Trigger*:

Why don’t you just try to not be retarded.

item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.description:
@Trigger1 wrote:

Why don’t you just try it then post if there is anything wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

ok so its just

public static int removePlayer(int id) { if (players[id] == null) { return 0; } if (players[id].online) { try { fileManager.saveCharacter(players[id]); } catch (Exception e) { } } players[id].destruct(); players[id] = null; Server.socketListener.removeSocket(id); return -1; }
?

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

No need for the extra }

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.description:
@Trigger1 wrote:

Whats with the extra bracket.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:9, topic:237405”][quote author=xstrxpurez link=topic=313455.msg2495281#msg2495281 date=1224366936]

public static int removePlayer(int id) { if (players[id] == null) { return 0; } if (players[id].online) { try { fileManager.saveCharacter(players[id]); } catch (Exception e) { } } players[id].destruct(); players[id] = null; Server.socketListener.removeSocket(id); }
there
[/quote]
Add a return statement to the end of the method?[/quote]

so it looks like this?

public static int removePlayer(int id) { if (players[id] == null) { return 0; } if (players[id].online) { try { fileManager.saveCharacter(players[id]); } catch (Exception e) { } } players[id].destruct(); players[id] = null; Server.socketListener.removeSocket(id); } return -1; }

Read full topic

there[/quote]

@Trigger1 wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:3, topic:237405”]now i get this…

.\palidino76\rs2\Engine.java:262: missing return statement } ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

public static int removePlayer(int id) { if (players[id] == null) { return 0; } if (players[id].online) { try { fileManager.saveCharacter(players[id]); } catch (Exception e) { } } players[id].destruct(); players[id] = null; Server.socketListener.removeSocket(id); }

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:5, topic:237405”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=313455.msg2495268#msg2495268 date=1224366536]
You need to learn basic method structure, e.g:

public int getSomething(int i) { if(i == 0) { return 0; } else if(i == 1) { return 99; } return -1; // If none of the above statements are true. }
[/quote]

i know the basic structure… but everytime i add the return 0; it asks for something else… then i fix the next error… then it gives me another… it just keeps going[/quote]
Post the method, and I’ll have a go.

Read full topic
